summary: Constitution with 26 rules (26 mandatory) across categories: Quality: 2, Safety: 1, Security: 1, Performance: 2, Containerization: 3, Configuration: 1, Testing: 4, Documentation: 2, Principles: 2, Stability: 1, Observability: 1, GitOps: 2, CI/CD: 1, Architecture: 1, Networking: 1, Resource Management: 1

rules.title: Comprehensive Decoupling
rules.description: Identify all parts and functionalities that can be extracted as separate modules (libraries) and reused in various projects. Perform additional work to make each module fully decoupled and independent. Each module must be a separate project with its own CLAUDE.md, AGENTS.md, README.md, docs/, tests, and challenges.

rules.title: 100% Test Coverage
rules.description: Every component MUST have 100% test coverage across ALL test types: unit, integration, E2E, security, stress, chaos, automation, and benchmark tests. No false positives. Use real data and live services (mocks only in unit tests).

rules.title: Comprehensive Challenges
rules.description: Every component MUST have Challenge scripts validating real-life use cases. No false success - validate actual behavior, not return codes.

rules.title: Complete Documentation
rules.description: Every module and feature MUST have complete documentation: README.md, CLAUDE.md, AGENTS.md, user guides, step-by-step manuals, video courses, diagrams, SQL definitions, and website content. No component can remain undocumented.

rules.title: No Broken Components
rules.description: No module, application, library, or test can remain broken, disabled, or incomplete. Everything must be fully functional and operational.

rules.title: No Dead Code
rules.description: Identify and remove all 'dead code' - features or functionalities left unconnected with the system. Perform comprehensive research and cleanup.

rules.title: Memory Safety
rules.description: Perform comprehensive research for memory leaks, deadlocks, and race conditions. Apply safety fixes and improvements to prevent these issues.

rules.title: Security Scanning
rules.description: Execute Snyk and SonarQube scanning. Analyze findings in depth and resolve everything. Ensure scanning infrastructure is accessible via containerization (Docker/Podman).

rules.title: Monitoring and Metrics
rules.description: Create tests that run and perform monitoring and metrics collection. Use collected data for proper optimizations.

rules.title: Lazy Loading and Non-Blocking
rules.description: Implement lazy loading and lazy initialization wherever possible. Introduce semaphore mechanisms and non-blocking mechanisms to ensure flawless responsiveness.

rules.title: Software Principles
rules.description: Apply all software principles: KISS, DRY, SOLID, YAGNI, etc. Ensure code is clean, maintainable, and follows best practices.

rules.title: Design Patterns
rules.description: Use appropriate design patterns: Proxy, Facade, Factory, Abstract Factory, Observer, Mediator, Strategy, etc. Apply patterns where they add value.

rules.title: Rock-Solid Changes
rules.description: All changes must be safe, non-error-prone, and MUST NOT BREAK any existing working functionality. Ensure backward compatibility unless explicitly breaking.

rules.title: Stress and Integration Tests
rules.description: Introduce comprehensive stress and integration tests validating that the system is responsive and not possible to overload or break.

rules.title: Full Containerization
rules.description: All services MUST run in containers (Docker/Podman/K8s). Support local default execution AND remote configuration. Services must auto-boot before HelixAgent is ready.

rules.title: Mandatory Container Orchestration Flow
rules.description: The ONLY acceptable container orchestration flow: (1) HelixAgent boots and initializes Containers module adapter, (2) Adapter reads Containers/.env file (NOT project root .env), (3) Based on CONTAINERS_REMOTE_ENABLED: true=ALL containers to remote hosts via CONTAINERS_REMOTE_HOST_* vars, false/missing=ALL containers locally, (4) Health checks against configured endpoints, (5) Required services failing health check cause boot failure. Rules: NO manual container starts, NO mixed mode, tests use tests/precondition/containers_boot_test.go, challenges verify container placement. Key files: Containers/.env, internal/config/config.go:isContainersRemoteEnabled(), internal/services/boot_manager.go, tests/precondition/containers_boot_test.go.

rules.title: Unified Configuration
rules.description: CLI agent config export uses only HelixAgent + LLMsVerifier's unified generator. No third-party scripts.

rules.title: Health and Monitoring
rules.description: Every service MUST expose health endpoints. Circuit breakers for all external dependencies. Prometheus/OpenTelemetry integration.

rules.title: GitSpec Compliance
rules.description: Follow GitSpec constitution and all constraints from AGENTS.md and CLAUDE.md.

rules.title: SSH Only for Git Operations
rules.description: MANDATORY: NEVER use HTTPS for any Git service operations. All cloning, fetching, pushing, and submodule operations MUST use SSH URLs (git@github.com:org/repo.git). HTTPS is STRICTLY FORBIDDEN even for public repositories. SSH keys are already configured on all Git services (GitHub, GitLab, etc.).

rules.title: Manual CI/CD Only
rules.description: NO GitHub Actions enabled. All CI/CD workflows and pipelines must be executed manually only.

rules.title: Documentation Synchronization
rules.description: Anything added to Constitution MUST be present in AGENTS.md and CLAUDE.md, and vice versa. Keep all three synchronized.

rules.title: Container-Based Builds
rules.description: ALL release builds MUST be performed inside Docker/Podman containers for reproducibility. Use `make release` / `make release-all`. Version info injected via `-ldflags -X`. No release binaries should be built directly on the host unless container build is unavailable.

rules.title: Infrastructure Before Tests
rules.description: ALL infrastructure containers (PostgreSQL, Redis, Mock LLM) MUST be running before executing tests or challenges. Use `make test-infra-start` or `make test-infra-direct-start` (Podman fallback with `--userns=host`). Tests and challenges that require infrastructure WILL FAIL without running containers.
